context: Would this work on a New Zealand PS3?
response: Not sure but I did not like the game

context: When I plug the cable into the controller the green light quickly turns on and off. Has this happened to anyone else?
response: That totally happened to me.  As I said in my review, after switching controllers, I eventually found one that worked.  So, I would suggest using different controllers as the charging point until you find the one that will work consistently.  If you only have one controller... I don't know what to tell you.

It responds as any 360 controller would. ive never tried it on fifa, so I don't know if u can map buttons on it. You can probably get a cheaper stick if that is your main use for it. Its a good stick. It has very responsive buttons and handle.

context: Unless I actually worked at a Microsoft factory and produced the console, what is the reason I should buy this ?
response: Haha you shouldn't. Microsoft released the white edition of the Xbox one with the sunset overdrive bundle releasing October 28th.

context: Does this work with a Mac?
response: I am not sure. I use it for windows vista. I think Logitech has a website that should tell you.

context: How loud of sound do the keys on the keyboard make when typing? Does it give off a loud "click clacky" sound when typing?
response: Honestly at first it does make quite a loud "typing" noise as you said, yet you get used to it after a while. If you are thinking of getting this to use at night and not wake anyone that's in the same room, it's not gonna work.

context: Does flightstick  Pro USB 4 have adjustable spring and is it x-y centered
response: No adjustable springs. it is x-y centered and comes with good software. I use it because it is one of the few sticks made that left handed players can use.

context: Considering buying V-MODA Crossfade LP and BoomPro mic. Worried that the mic will be too loud or too quiet. Can Xbox adjust the mic perfectly?
response: move the mic away from your mouth

context: crazy machines #53 stuck on 53. Turned on light then put ball in pocket per the answer page but it fails to recognize completion of game. Help! Is there a way to skip on to the next game?
response: I had the same problem.  Solved this puzzle three different ways (ball in wooden basket, plants thriving in the light) and didn't get the completion box.  What's up? And is there a way to skip past a puzzle? Thanks.

context: Is this Legendary Edition an actual standalone version of Skyrim, or is it an add-on where I would need to buy the original game as well?
response: This is the game plus the add-ons. You don't need to buy anything else. Just make sure you have a Steam account.

context: Will this work on iMac Maverick OS?
response: I have a mac and it plays with no problems!

context: I want to buy this for my 14 year old son for Christmas.  However, I'm confused by the PC download vs. the PC version.  Which is the way to go?
response: PC - Download, its a digital code that you redeem on steam, you will have to then download the whole game.PC - Version it the game itself on DVD.

context: do you have to use the remote and nunchuck? or can you plat this game just with the remote. no nunchuk
response: You can play it with a Classic Controller

context: do you have to use the remote and nunchuck? or can you plat this game just with the remote. no nunchuk
response: On the back of the game it shows Wii remote with nun chuck, classic controller, or GameCube controller all as viable options.

context: do you need to pay to play this game?
response: Only thew initislt purchase price. No monthly subscription required.
